Review:
The box feels and looks fairly premium, so that's nice. I have used a laser hair removal device before so I knew a bit of what to expect.

It comes with safety glasses and while they do not feel premium they are very dark and you should for sure be using them when using the device. It does flash very bright and I try to not look directly at it but the glasses do help a lot. They are not comfortable though, but you only really wear them to use it. I just keep them in the bathroom drawer with it so it's no big deal. It comes with a razor because you will want to shave the area before using it. I've tried it with slightly grown out hair and clean shaven and I think it works better with clean shaven.

It has 2 modes, a hair removal mode and a skin rejuvenation mode. I'm not sure what the difference is exactly? But I only use it on HR (hair removal mode) anyway. You can set the lazer to auto pulse or trigger when you push the button and I like to trigger it when I push the button so I know when it will pulse.

When you are using it you actually don't feel it unless you do several in the same spot right after each other. I think doing 2 back to back is fine but more than that kind of hurts and I'm not sure it really helps? But I try to use this 2 times a week like the manual says and it can take 8 weeks to see full results. I wasn't sore or anything after using it.

All in all I think it's worth trying out. It's small and easy to maneuver and it doesn't feel cheap or anything. The glasses are darker than any I had so it's nice they include them. The razor is nothing special, but I guess it's there if you need it. If you are thinking of trying a lazer hair removal device I'd say this one seems nice. I have never had it professionally done and I like that I can do this at home when I feel like it. I'll update the review when I get to 8 weeks for full results. My hair is a darker brown and I think that helps. The manual says it may not work as well on lighter hair or darker skin. Just FYI.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2024

Review:
This IPL hair removal device ha
s been a game-changer for my at-home hair removal routine. The standout feature is definitely the ice-cooling technology - it really helps make the process more comfortable by cooling the skin to 5°C before treatment. I was initially hesitant about at-home IPL, but the 9 adjustable power levels let me start low and gradually increase as I got comfortable with the device.

After about 7 weeks of consistent use, I've noticed a significant reduction in hair regrowth. The dual-mode feature is super practical - I use manual mode for precise areas like underarms and automated mode for larger areas like legs. The ergonomic design with the curved body and well-placed flash button makes it easy to maneuver, even in tricky spots.

The device comes with everything you need - protective goggles, a shaver, and clear instructions. I particularly appreciate the built-in safety features like the skin tone sensor and the filtered light waves. The 999,900 flashes mean I won't need to replace it anytime soon, making it a great value compared to salon treatments.

One thing to note - make sure to check if your skin tone and hair color are compatible before purchasing (it works best on lighter skin tones with darker hair). Overall, this has been an excellent investment in reducing unwanted hair while saving time and money on salon visits. The cooling feature really sets it apart from other IPL devices I've tried.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2025

Review:
There are multiple different at home IPL devices on Amazon to choose from, I was pretty skeptical about all at home hair removal products because I’ve tried them in the past and they just didn’t work. Technology has come a long way though, and I decided to try again.

I didn’t want to try the most expensive product for obvious reasons, and this product seemed to have all of the pros without having a larger price tag. I’m shocked at how well it’s been working, it’s easy to use, pain level is absolutely nothing, and the size of coverage seems large enough to get the job done.

Full disclosure, I’ve had professional laser hair removal done in the past, but I wanted something at home for touch ups because no laser hair removal is going to last forever unfortunately. I was going on a tropical Christmas vacation and wanted to touch up my bikini area. I got this product about a month and a half before the trip, started using it every other day for a few weeks and I’m happy to say that my rogue bikini hairs have stopped growing! So this product definitely does work, yes it takes some consistency and a little more up front work, but for the price tag and the fact that you can get unlimited touch ups makes it worth it!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025

Review:
I usually need to Seabreeze and wax my upper lip once a week, then spend the next hour applying ice to avoid most of the red bumps and the itchies.
I'm not only Lebanese but have had PCOS since puberty. Any woman familiar with that horrible acronym knows what happens in the most embarrassing places and being Leb means black hair, even if it's sparse.
My daughter, against my best efforts, developed PCOS after going to college and eating garbage, like most college kids do. If this works for me, I'm getting one for her and so far, at least on my upper lip, it's working beautifully! As I continue using it on my underarms, legs and those embarrassing areas, I'll update and HOPEFULLY not need to remove any more stars!
"Speaking" of stars, the only reason I removed one is the buttons are really easy to hit while you're using the device. I'm 5'2" with small hands and this device is cumbersome with no grippy areas, which would help ENORMOUSLY! It's super smooth, making hitting some areas precarious.

Update: I've been using it for 6 weeks and haven't had one hair grow back on my upper lip, jaw line and sideburn area since my FIRST USE! No more waxing!! Haven't had the same results with my armpits but I'll continue and hope for the best.
Maybe I'll tackle my thighs next! I've ordered one for my daughter and couldn't be more thrilled to be rescuing her from the hair hell I've lived with my entire life!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2024

Review:
I'm blown away by the Ubroo Laser Hair Removal device! As someone who's struggled with unwanted hair for years, I was skeptical about trying an at-home solution. But this device has genuinely changed my hair removal routine.

The 5℃ ice cooling feature is a game-changer - it makes the process virtually painless. The device is also incredibly easy to use, with clear instructions and adjustable settings for different skin types and hair colors.

I've been using the device for a few weeks now, and I've already noticed a significant reduction in hair growth. The device is also versatile, allowing me to target different areas of my body, from my face to my legs.

Overall, I'm thoroughly impressed with the Ubroo Laser Hair Removal device. It's saved me time and money on salon visits, and has given me the confidence to show off my smooth, hair-free skin.

Highly recommend!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2025

Review:
Ages ago, when home IPL first became available, I tried it. I had a device that I used for a while, gritting my teeth every time I zapped myself. I'm a bit of a wimp about pain, and although I did see some results with the device, I quit using it well before I could really get the best out of it. Recently, I saw a Facebook ad for an IPL device with cooling, and I started researching this new (to me) marvel. I was a little skeptical that the cooling head could really make the device painless, but I thought maybe it could make it tolerable for wimpy me. I kept seeing much more expensive devices that received good reviews from various other websites, but didn't have the best Amazon reviews. I decided to try this much less expensive one that Amazon users seemed pleased with, and I'm very happy with that decision.

I'm still fairly wimpy and have so far only turned the device up to level 4. However, it truly is painless. I don't find myself wincing or hesitating to pull the trigger. And I love that I can put it on auto to get my legs done more quickly and efficiently. I've even used it for a couple of stray hairs at the corner of my mouth, and no pain whatsoever. Only time will tell how well it will end up working, but with the success I saw with the previous device, I expect this to go well.

My only complaint is with the instructions, which were pretty brief and nothing resembling thorough. I had to watch some videos to figure out how to get the machine into auto mode, and although the instructions mention that there are three modes (for hair removal, "skin rejuvenation," and acne), it never mentions anything about those other two modes--what they are, or how to use them. Nor does it make any suggestions as to what intensity you should be aiming for or how to choose which intensity to aim for. If I could have docked the product a half star for that, I would have, but it's not worth taking it down a full star. Really please with the product, especially for the price!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2024

Review: I have been using this product for 2 months and the difference is already showing! I can go longer without shaving anywhere I have lasered. Being consistent and having patience are the key. It’s a great value for the cost as it has multiple modes: hair removal, skin rejuvenation, and acne treatment. I love that it has many functions which makes it a more versatile product. It was very easy to use and it was comfortable to hold while doing my legs. I like that it can do auto mode which makes it easy to get everything done quickly! It took less than 10 minutes to do both legs. Overall I’m happy with this purchase!
